text: Jeremy, I first thought that the idea of great pizza in Japan was a little crazy, but thank you for posting this video! I visited Pizza Strada in November; the Margherita and the Bismarck are among the best I have ever tasted! I can't wait to visit the other spots on my next trip.
author: @Scotty-rz3fz

text: Some good spots you hit, been to most, not all but‚Ä¶ living in Tokyo for the past ten years, napolitano is awesome. I‚Äôve actually been on the hunt for something extremely simple but is incredibly hard to come across and that is a good pepperoni. I do have my spots to grab a NY slice with pepperoni but it would be great if real pepperoni was offered in Tokyo and not a thin sliced salami that is sometimes called pepperoni. The other crave I have which may not exist in the napolitano style is the ‚Äúno flop‚Äù.  I do have a hidden spot that I hit that has a ‚ÄúBismarck‚Äù napolitano style with a little crunch with white sauce, white asparagus, nama ham, buffalo mozzarella and egg in the center. Pizza, salad w/ focaccia, drink and handmade dessert‚Ä¶ ¬•990 for lunch. In Shimomaruko next to a 711 across the street from McDonald‚Äôs, husband and wife duo, great people and they always give me my normal table at lunch. Try it.
author: @yokosomike

text: the owner of Seirinkan is considered one of the first people to bring Neapolitan style pizza to Japan. it was originally called Savoy, which he then opened a few other places under that name. there was one in Roppongi, which was where Tamaki originally trained. Tamaki then opened Strada at the current location with a business partner, and he ran it for a while. then Tamaki split and opened his own pizza place, which is PST.  so most of the pizza places listed here branch from Seirinkan.
author: @dr.shousa

text: Of the ones you visited, we were only able to hit Savoy Tomato & Cheese in Roppongi. Their bluefin tuna pizza was outstanding, as was their margherita. Personally, Neapolitan isn't my favorite style, and I prefer low-moisture mozzarella instead of fresh, but Savoy's Neapolitan-style pizza was better than the pizza I had at 50 Kal√≤ in Naples last year.
author: @dough5186

text: Hi, just found your channel yesterday! Could you put the places you visit in your description to make it easier to remember their names for later? Thanks, and you have great framing/videography skills :)

text: This is helpful for people who travel throughout Asia for extended periods of time as it is nice to have a break from the delicious Asian food from time to time.  Luckily you can get all types of outstanding Western cuisine all over Asia as the chefs there are technically highly skilled.
